condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, increased proportions of population have access to adequate, equitable and sustainable basic drinking water services in households, schools and health care facilities in target rural, peri-urban and humanitarian settings

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Government in ensuring equitable access to drinking water for schools, health centres and communities. In communities, the establishment and training of water point management committees contributed to ensuring sustainability of water services and the inclusion and ownership for 57,373 beneficiaries. Access to drinking water was also improved in institutions, including in 15 schools and 4 health centres provided with basic water services. For cholera response, 202,400 people had access to drinking water thanks to UNICEF interventions. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:27/12/2019
